intro: Mellichampia sinaloensis, commonly known as the Sinaloan mellichampia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
